shape_to_WKT>shape_to_WKT.yml@12|shape_d.description: Text string representing the file path to the spatial file containing the spatial boundaries pertaining to the study area. Accepted file types include shapefile (.shp). This path specifies the complete path location of the file within the file system and is utilized for identifying and accessing the spatial boundaries contained within the file.
shape_to_WKT>shape_to_WKT.yml@12|shape_d.label: study area geometry

shape_to_WKT>shape_to_WKT.yml@12|epsg.description: Numerical value referring to the EPSG code (European Petroleum Survey Group) associated with the spatial reference system that will be used as a reference for the study area. This numerical value specifies the projection and geodetic datum used to define the coordinates and spatial representation of the data in the study area. For further information on coordinate systems and EPSG codes, you can access the official database on the EPSG website at https://epsg.org/home.html. The website provides documentation, resources, and tools for searching and understanding the EPSG codes used in various geospatial contexts
shape_to_WKT>shape_to_WKT.yml@12|epsg.label: study area EPSG in

load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|c.description: Path where the collection is hosted. The path can be hosted on the BIAB server (subject to approval from administrators) or in a cloud container
load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|c.label: collection path

load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|r.description: Numerical value referring to the spatial resolution (pixel size) in square meters to create a grid of the study area. This value indicates the level of detail or granularity at which the study area will be analyzed. Each pixel will be considered as a study site for occupancy analyses. A value of 100 represents an hectare and a value of 1000 represents a square kilometer.
load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|r.label: resolution

load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|t.description: String refering to the periods or intervals used for analysis. It specifies the length and units of time that will be considered for analyzing the data. For example, time intervals like 10Y (10 years), 5Y (5 years), 4M (4 months) can be used to define the time granularity for conducting the analysis. If no interval (time_interval) is specified, '1Y' is used by default
load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|t.label: time interval

load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|t.description: Refering to the starting date of the time interval. If this value is null or not provided, the minimum date from the column_date will be automatically taken as the starting date for the analysis. This argument is ignored if column_date=NULL
load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|t.label: Start of time interval

load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|t.description: Refering to the ending date of the time interval. If this value is null or not provided, the minimum date from the column_date will be automatically taken as the starting date for the analysis. This argument is ignored if column_date=NULL.
load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|t.label: End of time interval

reclassify>reclassify.yml@21|table_recla.description: Table with the reclassification values used to classify the collection.
reclassify>reclassify.yml@21|table_recla.label: reclassify table

reclassify>reclassify.yml@21|compare_dat.description: Comparative table summarizing the pixel count results in each of the human footprint reclassification categories for each period.
reclassify>reclassify.yml@21|compare_dat.label: Pixel count for each category and year

load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|f.description: Raster maps showing the Human Footprint for each pixel and for each time period
load_collection>load_collection.yml@13|f.label: Human Footprint Index maps

metadata.name: Human footprint time series calculation for Colombia
metadata.description: This pipeline starts with a time series of raster maps representing the Human Footprint Index for each pixel. The maps are then reclassified into different human footprint levels and summary statistics for each level and each time perio are extracted.
